definitions.definition: Moving around; astir.
definitions.example: After my bout with Guillan-Barre Syndrome, it took me 6 months to be up and about again.

definitions.definition: In existence; being in evidence; apparent.
definitions.example: This idea has been about for a while but has only recently become fashionable.

definitions.definition: Near; in the vicinity or neighbourhood.
definitions.example: I had my keys just a minute ago, so they must be about somewhere.

definitions.definition: On all sides; around.
definitions.example: I looked about at the scenery that surrounded me.

definitions.definition: Here and there; around; in one place and another; up and down.
definitions.example: Bits of old machinery were lying about.

definitions.definition: From one place or position to another in succession; indicating repeated movement or activity.
definitions.example: walking about;  rushing about;  jumping about;  thrashing about

definitions.definition: Indicating unproductive or unstructured activity.
definitions.example: messing about;   fooling about;  loafing about

definitions.definition: Nearly; approximately; with close correspondence in quality, manner, degree, quantity, or time; almost.
Near; in the vicinity.
To a reversed order; half round; facing in the opposite direction; from a contrary point of view.
definitions.example: to face about;  to turn oneself about

definitions.definition: In succession; one after another; in the course of events.
In circuit; circularly; by a circuitous way; around the outside; in circumference.
definitions.example: a mile about, and a third of a mile across

definitions.definition: In a circle around; all round; on every side of; on the outside of.
definitions.example: The snake was coiled about his ankle.

definitions.definition: Over or upon different parts of; through or over in various directions; here and there in; to and fro in; throughout.
definitions.example: He was well known about town.

definitions.definition: Indicates that something will happen very soon; indicates a plan or intention to do something.
Concerning; with regard to; on account of; on the subject of; to affect.
definitions.example: He talked a lot about his childhood.

definitions.definition: Concerned with; engaged in; intent on.
Within or in the immediate neighborhood of; in contiguity or proximity to; near, as to place.
definitions.example: I can't find my reading glasses, but they must be somewhere about the house.

definitions.definition: On one's person; nearby the person.
definitions.example: I had no weapon about me but a stick.

definitions.definition: In or near, as in mental faculties or in the possession of; under the control of; at one's command; in one's makeup.
definitions.example: He has his wits about him.
